intro: Schoenoplectus clemensiae, commonly known as the Clemens' bulrush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense stands in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Schoenoplectus clemensiae plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
